title: Indonesiaâ€™s Joko Anwar Receives French Cultural Honor
description: Indonesian filmmaker Joko Anwar has been awarded the Chevalier de lâ€™Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the French government, receiving the prestigiou
body:
Indonesian filmmaker Joko Anwar has been awarded the Chevalier de lâ€™Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the French government, receiving the prestigious cultural honor at a ceremony held at the French Ministry of Culture in Paris.

	French Minister of Culture Rachida Dati presented the award, recognizing Anwarâ€™s two-decade career and his impact on both Indonesian and international cinema. The honor places the director among a distinguished list of recipients that includes Martin Scorsese, David Lynch, Tim Burton, Pedro AlmodÃ³var, Meryl Streep, Cate Blanchett and Miyazaki Hayao.
	

	â€œHe established a unique artistic signature, exploring collective fears, social tensions, myths, and beliefs that shape our collective imagination,â€ Dati said. â€œHis filmography spans a wide range of genres with rare freedom. He reinvented these genres with deep narrative vision and a singular aesthetic â€“ blending traditional culture, social commentary, and gripping suspense.â€


	During his acceptance speech, Anwar reflected on his approach to filmmaking. â€œThrough stories packaged in horror, thrillers, or comedies, I try to talk about things that are often difficult to discuss directly: injustice, power, humans and the environment in which they live,â€ he said, noting that many of his works emerge from concerns about social and ecological issues.

	The award arrives as Anwar prepares to release his twelfth feature, â€œGhost in the Cell,â€ a horror-comedy co-produced by Barunson E&A, which is also handling worldwide sales. Set for release in 2026, the film uses a prison setting as a metaphor while addressing themes of environmental degradation, power and moral responsibility.
	

	â€œâ€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ is part of the same conversation Iâ€™ve always wanted to build through my films,â€ Anwar said. â€œUsing genre to entertain, but also to encourage audiences to think about the world we live in.â€

	The Ordre des Arts et des Lettres represents one of the highest cultural honors bestowed by the French government, recognizing significant contributions to arts and literature internationally.

schema.headline: Indonesiaâ€™s Joko Anwar Receives French Cultural Honor

title: James Woods Tears Up Over â€˜Infuriatingâ€™ Remarks About â€˜Patriotâ€™ Rob Reiner: â€˜Because You Disagree With People, Doesnâ€™t Mean You Have to Hate Peopleâ€™
description:
James Woods, who has been vocally pro-Donald Trump, is speaking out against the â€œdistastefulâ€ comments made about Rob Reiner.

	Woods, who starred i
body:
James Woods, who has been vocally pro-Donald Trump, is speaking out against the â€œdistastefulâ€ comments made about Rob Reiner.

	Woods, who starred in Reinerâ€™s â€œGhosts of Mississippiâ€ in 1996, opened up about his late friend during an appearance on Fox News on Monday night, revealing that he was at a low point and landing that job turned it around.

	â€œRob literally saved my career and really put me back on track in a way that was so important and rewarding in my life. He really fought for me when a studio didnâ€™t want me in a movie,â€ Woods said. â€œI went from really being basically out of a job to getting an Academy Award nomination, and I give all the credit to Rob.â€
	

	Getting choked up multiple times during the interview with Jesse Watters, Woods explained that friends would often ask him how he could be friends with the director, despite their opposing political views; Reiner was a liberal activist, while Woods has been outspoken about supporting Trump.

	â€œI judge people by how they treat me, and Rob Reiner was a Godsend in my life. We got along great, we loved each otherâ€¦ He was always on my side,â€ Woods said. â€œWhen people would say to me, â€˜What do you think of his politics?â€™ I would say, â€˜I think Rob Reiner is a great patriot. Do I agree on many of his ideas on how that patriotism should be enacted, to celebrate the America that we both love? No. He doesnâ€™t agree with me either, but he also respects my patriotism. We had a different path to the same destination, which was a country we both love.â€

	He added, â€œBecause you disagree with people doesnâ€™t mean that you have to hate people.â€
	

	After noting that Reiner was â€œa real thinkerâ€ and â€œa lot of people just donâ€™t think anymore,â€ Woods brought up how Reiner spoke about Charlie Kirk after he was assassinated in September. (In his last interview, Reiner was asked about Kirkâ€™s death, and he called it â€œhorrible,â€ adding, â€œI donâ€™t care what your political beliefs are. Thatâ€™s not acceptable. Thatâ€™s not a solution to solving problems.â€)

	â€œI knew Charlie Kirk, I supported himâ€¦ people said some such horrible things, and Rob did not,â€ Woods said on Monday night. â€œWhen people say horrible things about Rob right now, I find it, quite frankly, infuriating and distasteful. Did I agree with his politics? I did not. Did I love him as I friend, as an artist, as an icon of Hollywood, and as a patriot? I most certainly did, and I am just absolutely devastated.â€

	Reiner and his wife, Michele Reiner, were murdered on Sunday, December 14, in their home in Brentwood, Calif. Following the deaths, Trump posted on TruthSocial that the director â€œpassed away, together with his wife, Michele, reportedly due to the anger he caused others through his massive, unyielding, and incurable affliction with a mind crippling disease known as TRUMP DERANGEMENT SYNDROME, sometimes referred to as TDS.â€

	In a press conference later that day, he added, â€œI wasnâ€™t a fan of his at all. He was a deranged person as far as Trump is concerned. â€¦ I thought he was very bad for our country.â€

	Watch Woodsâ€™ segment below:

ğŸš¨ MUST WATCH: Legendary Actor JAMES WOODS gets EMOTIONAL when talking about ROB REINERâ€™S MURDER ğŸš¨â€œRob literally SAVED my CAREER and really put me back on track in a way that was so important and rewarding in my lifeâ€ ğŸ¤¯â€œPeople would go, â€˜How is it that you and Rob Reinerâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/XTCc0LYkfRâ€” Jesse Watters (@JesseBWatters) December 16, 2025

schema.headline: James Woods Tears Up Over â€˜Infuriatingâ€™ Remarks About â€˜Patriotâ€™ Rob Reiner: â€˜Because You Disagree With People, Doesnâ€™t Mean You Have to Hate Peopleâ€™

title: â€˜Bootsâ€™ Canceled by Netflix After First Season
description:
Netflix has canceled â€œBootsâ€ after just one season, Variety has learned. The coming-of-age queer drama series debuted on the streamer on Oct. 9.

	E
body:
Netflix has canceled â€œBootsâ€ after just one season, Variety has learned. The coming-of-age queer drama series debuted on the streamer on Oct. 9.

	Executive produced by Norman Lear, who greenlighted the show back in 2023, and created by Andy Parker, â€œBootsâ€ was based on Greg Cope Whiteâ€™s book â€œThe Pink Marine.â€ Miles Heizer starred as Cameron Cope, a disillusioned, closeted â€˜90s teen who signs up for the Marine Corps with his best friend Ray McAffey, played by Liam Oh. Despite the unwelcoming environment (LGBTQ people were banned from the military at that time), the pair grow into themselves and form lifelong friendships with their fellow recruits as they navigate the social and physical hazards of boot camp.
	

	Other cast members include Ana Ayora, Blake Burt, Cedrick Cooper, Dominic Goodman, Nicholas Logan, Kieron Moore, Angus Oâ€™Brien, Rico Paris, Max Parker, Vera Farmiga, Brandon Tyer Moore and Mattie Liptak.


	During a recent sitdown with Variety, Heizer said the possibilities for queer stories in the military are endless. He shared his hopes for many more seasons.

	â€œThere are a lot of stories to tell, from more of Gregâ€™s different experiences in the Marines to Donâ€™t Ask, Donâ€™t Tell, to when it was repealed,â€ he said. â€œI would do it for 10 seasons if they let us.â€

	Jennifer Cecil served as showrunner and executive producer. Series creator Parker served as co-showrunner and executive producer. Rachel Davidson, Peter Hoar, Scott Hornbacher and Brent Miller also served as executive producers. Todd Lewis and Cyndi Brenner produced the show

schema.headline: â€˜Bootsâ€™ Canceled by Netflix After First Season

title: Jim Carrey â€˜Freaked Outâ€™ and â€˜Called Cutâ€™ When â€˜Grinchâ€™ Stunt Almost Hurt Child Co-Star Taylor Momsen: â€˜I Always Felt Really Safe With Jimâ€™
description: Taylor Momsen revealed in Vultureâ€™s oral history on â€œHow the Grinch Saved Christmasâ€ that Jim Carrey once stopped production in the middle of filmin
body:
Taylor Momsen revealed in Vultureâ€™s oral history on â€œHow the Grinch Saved Christmasâ€ that Jim Carrey once stopped production in the middle of filming when a stunt involving his child co-star nearly harmed her. Momsen was 7 years old when she filmed â€œGrinch,â€ which marked her feature film debut in a major Hollywood studio movie. 

	â€œI remember when we were shooting the scene coming down the mountain on the sled. It was this real sled that was up on a giant spring that was being controlled and moving from side to side, very aggressively,â€ Momsen told Vulture. â€œJim is leaning over and being extravagant Jim. There was a moment where I almost fell out of the sled, and he freaked out. He called cut and started checking in on me. I was having a great time. I was laughing; I wasnâ€™t thinking about the fact that I just almost fell very high off the ground.
	

	â€œI always felt really safe with Jim,â€ Momsen continued. â€œI liked being around him. At such a young age, to watch an artist who is that serious at what theyâ€™re doing even while playing this very over-the-top character, it was clear to me how much he was putting into it and how much of an artist he was.â€


	Carrey told Vulture that he could tell instantly that Momsen was â€œan incredibly precocious childâ€ and â€œsmart beyond her yearsâ€ when they first met before filming on the â€œGrinchâ€ movie started, adding: â€œHer comedy timing was impeccable. A total pro. I donâ€™t think she ever went up on a line or missed a cue or anything like that.â€

	Momsen â€œnever knew what Jim looked likeâ€ in real life, as she only ever saw him in full Grinch makeup when they were filming scenes together. The first time she actually met the real Jim Carrey was at the filmâ€™s premiere. The two recently made headlines after they reunited in November at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony and posed together for photos. It was the first time Momsen and Carrey saw each other in 25 years.
	

	â€œI turned around in the hallway, and she was standing there,â€ Carrey told Vulture about the unexpected reunion. â€œI donâ€™t know if she had heels or not, but sheâ€™s towering. Iâ€™m going, â€˜What?â€™ She has a really powerful manner. I was so glad sheâ€™s done so well for herself. Sheâ€™s been through some challenges in her life and come out the other side. It was very exciting to see her again. And she brought me a Crunchie, which is my favorite chocolate bar. That was awesome.â€

	Head over toÂ Vultureâ€™s websiteÂ to read the full â€œHow the Grinch Stole Christmasâ€ oral history.

schema.headline: Jim Carrey â€˜Freaked Outâ€™ and â€˜Called Cutâ€™ When â€˜Grinchâ€™ Stunt Almost Hurt Child Co-Star Taylor Momsen: â€˜I Always Felt Really Safe With Jimâ€™

title: Joe Ely, Texas Country-Rock Hero Who Grew His Fan Base Touring With the Clash, Dies at 78
description: Joe Ely, the singer-songwriter who helped drive a new wave of Texas-based music that united rock and country fans in the 1980s and beyond, died Mond
body:
Joe Ely, the singer-songwriter who helped drive a new wave of Texas-based music that united rock and country fans in the 1980s and beyond, died Monday. The cause of death was complications from Lewy Body Dementia, Parkinsonâ€™s disease and pneumonia. 

	An announcement from the family said that Ely died at his home in Taos, New Mexico, with his wife and manager, Sharon, and daughter, Marie, at this side.


	Ely had announced his diagnosis of Lewy body dementia and Parkinsonâ€™s in a Facebook post on Sept. 9, â€œnot to dwell in hardship, but to bring understanding, awareness and hope through the healing power of music,â€ he and his wife said in a statement at the time.
	

	â€œMy heroâ€¦ my templateâ€¦ my friendâ€¦ Joe Ely passed today,â€ tweeted Monte Warden, of another pioneering roots-rock act to rise up in that era, the Wagoneers. â€œHe means as much to me as Buddy, Elvis or Don Everly. Such an artist. Texan. Iâ€™m justâ€¦heartbroken.â€

	â€œJoe Ely performed American roots music with the fervor of a true believer who knew music could transport souls,â€ said Kyle Young, CEO of the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. â€œHis distinctive musical style could only have emerged from Texas, with its southwestern blend of honky-tonk, rock & roll, roadhouse blues, western swing, and conjunto.â€ While hailing Elyâ€™s long catalog of recordings, Young said that â€œhis true measure came through in the dynamic intensity of his powerhouse live performances, where he could stand his ground aside fellow zealots Bruce Springsteen, who recorded duets with Ely, and the Stones and the Clash, who took Ely on tour as an opening act.â€
	

	Ely was recognized as one of the more poetic souls of the Texas-rooted country-rock scene to rise up in the late â€™70s and â€™80s, but his shows often turned into sweaty rave-ups, as if Willie Nelson were overtaken by the spirit of rockabilly.

	In 1999, Modern Twang writer David Goodman called the Lubbock-bred Ely â€œthe consummate alternative country artist of the last 25 years,â€ and the passage of another quarter-century and change since that remark was made has not dimmed the accuracy of the description, in the minds of many roots-rock aficionados.

	A famous fan, Bruce Springsteen, said of Ely, â€œIâ€™ve been blessed to sing on his records and be onstage with Joe on occasion and the only thing I can say is: Thank God he wasnâ€™t born in New Jersey. I would have had a lot more of my work cut out for me.â€

	However much his music was country-based, at least in its earliest stages, Ely was beloved by several generations of rockers, many of whom first discovered him in plum spots opening for the biggest artists of the day, at their behest. Forty-five years ago this week, Ely was working as a support act for the Rolling Stones on a stadium tour, and he is equally renowned and remembered for his stint opening for the Clash. He also opened for Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers 17 times, along with acts including Stevie Nicks, Linda Ronstadt, the Pretenders, the Kinks and Jimmy Cliff.

	The fans he made doing those warmup gigs tended to stay fans throughout the decades, well after the fame by association of being favored by the Stones had worn off. 

	His best-known album may have been â€œMusta Notta Gotta Lotta,â€ which was the fourth recording he put out with MCA Records, with whom he signed in the 1970s. Earlier albums, including 1977â€™s self-titled debut, 1978â€™s â€œHonky Tonk Masqueradeâ€ and 1979â€™s â€œDown on the Drag,â€ may have been just as good, and produced at least as many classic country songs. But it was the harder-rocking tone of â€œMusta Nottaâ€¦â€ â€” along with all those gigs with the superstars â€” that kicked his career into gear with a wider audience.

	Elyâ€™s mercurial streak did not mean that he limited his output to â€œoutlaw country.â€ Indeed, with his next album, 1984â€™s â€œHi-Res,â€ he looked to broaden his sound beyond his essential roots appeal. But the reception to the departure this new music represented was mixed, and he soon parted ways with MCA, although he and the company would reunite in the â€™90s.
	

	Other career highlights included â€œLord of the Highwayâ€ from 1987, the first of two albums he would cut for Hightone Records. The most recent of his 17 studio albums was â€œLove and Freedom,â€ released earlier this year.

	His signature songs included â€œHonky Tonk Masquerade,â€ â€œFingernails,â€ â€œDallas,â€ â€œHard Livinâ€™,â€ â€œWishinâ€™ for Youâ€ and â€œShe Never Spoke Spanish to Me.â€ 

	Ely was born in Amarillo and moved to Lubbock at 11. He formed the Flatlanders in 1971 with Jimmie Dale Gilmore and Butch Hancock, whose material he recorded during his later solo career, as well. They released only one album during their initial lifespan, but reunited for â€œNow Againâ€ in 2002 and a followups in 2004, 2009 and 2021.

	After the Flatlanders broke up after one album, he had a stint working for the Ringling Brothers Circus, then found employment as a roofer. Forming his own band in Austin in the mid-â€™70s, he played the venue that would later become Stubbâ€™s, alternating nights with Stevie Ray Vaughan.

	It was Jerry Jeff Walkerâ€™s recommendation that was said to have led to the MCA signing in 1975.

	Elyâ€™s association with the Clash extended beyond his opening their gigs. He sang backup on â€œShould I Stay or Should I Go?,â€ and he was mentioned by name in the â€œSandinista!â€ song â€œIf Music Could Talkâ€ (â€œWell there ainâ€™t no better blend than Joe Ely and his Texas Menâ€).

	In the 1990s, he formed a short-lived supergroup called the Buzzinâ€™ Cousins with John Mellencamp, John Prine and James McMurtry, which resulted in his sole Grammy nomination.

	His â€œHi-Resâ€ album in the mid-â€™80s was not his only more experimental work. His album â€œB4 84â€ was reported to be one of the first albums ever recorded on an Apple II desktop computer, and Apple co-founder Steve Jobs wrote the liner notes.

	He was inducted into the Austin City Limits Hall of Fame in 2022. Prior to that, in 2007, Ely was awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award for Live Performance by the Americana Music Association; named the Texas State Musician for 2016; and, in that same year, inducted into the Texas Heritage Songwritersâ€™ Association Hall of Fame that same year.

	His family said that more information would be forthcoming in the coming days.

schema.headline: Joe Ely, Texas Country-Rock Hero Who Grew His Fan Base Touring With the Clash, Dies at 78

title: How Hilton Cancun Takes the Stress Out of Trip Planning
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Cancun, M
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Cancun, Mexico, is famous for turquoise waters and white-sand beaches, but even the most picturesque destinations can be stressful to navigate. For families juggling kids, couples looking for a romantic escape, or business travelers trying to mix work with leisure, planning every detail of a getaway can quickly become overwhelming. Hilton Cancun, an All-Inclusive Resort, is solving that problem with its curated itineraries, which map out a seamless experience without feeling rigid â€” making it easy to enjoy the resortâ€™s variety of dining options and amenities without overthinking each day.


	Whether youâ€™re parents enjoying quiet moments while the kids explore the Kids and Teens Club, couples finding time for private beachfront dinners, or professionals blending meetings with downtime, the itineraries act as a blueprint for stress-free travel. The resortâ€™s all-inclusive model means meals, drinks, entertainment, and amenities are covered, leaving guests to focus on what really matters: relaxing, connecting, and making the most of their vacation or work-cation.

	By taking the guesswork out of planning, Hilton Cancun, an All-Inclusive Resort, positions itself as more than a resort â€” itâ€™s a thoughtfully-designed escape where families, couples, and business travelers can all experience Cancun effortlessly. From sunrise yoga to evening entertainment, the resortâ€™s curated itinerary approach ensures every traveler can make the most of their stay without sacrificing comfort or flexibility.

	Hereâ€™s what to know about the Hilton property and what to expect from your experience there.

	
		On-Site Amenities for Every Type of Traveler	

	Hilton Cancun, an All-Inclusive Resort, is built around convenience. Parents can drop kids at the Kids & Teens Clubs, where daily programming ranges from hands-on crafts, to games and themed activities. Couples can carve out private moments in the resortâ€™s lounges or at the pool, participate in oceanfront yoga, or enjoy nightly entertainment as a family.

	Around the resort, the four distinct pools give every group its own spot: a splash pool for younger kids, a family pool for all-ages hangouts, and quieter corners for adults who just want a moment.



	

									Hilton
	



	Dining is just as versatile. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner options range from casual tacos at Maxal Taqueria to Mediterranean-inspired cuisine at La Luce, along with poolside bites at Seasalt. With the resortâ€™s all-inclusive model, meals, drinks, and entertainment are handled, so guests can focus on enjoying their stay rather than planning logistics.
	
		On-Site Add-Ons That Elevate Your Stay	

	When you want something a little extra, the Hilton Cancun, an All-Inclusive Resort, offers add-ons for every type of traveler. Families can spend an afternoon at the indoor activity park, perfect for burning energy or escaping the heat. Those craving a reset can book a treatment at the Waldorf Astoria Spa, while culinary explorers can join a tequila tasting without ever leaving the property.

	The resort also offers curated, pay-as-you-go packages that fit seamlessly into the week. Families can choose the IntrÃ©poli Adventure Pass, giving kids a full afternoon of hands-on games like Go-Karts and laser tag. Adults can retreat to the Amai Beach Club, a kid-free tropical haven for lounging, cocktails, and beachfront downtime. For guests celebrating milestonesâ€”or just in the mood to indulgeâ€”the Special Moments Package, which pairs wine, treats and other romantic touches, or dive into a spa package for multi-hour treatments designed to reset both body and mind. Each add-on is optional, making it easy to tailor the trip without overplanning.
	
		Off-Resort Add-On Excursions for Adventure and Exploration	

	For those who want to venture beyond the resort, Hilton Cancun, an All-Inclusive Resort, makes it simple to book stress-free excursions. Families can wander through the Mayan ruins at ChichÃ©n ItzÃ¡ or hop on a catamaran to Isla Mujeres for snorkeling and a day in the sun. Couples can slip into a YucatÃ¡n nature escape or enjoy a nearby dinner-and-acrobatics show, blending adventure with a touch of romance. Groups and business travelers can fit in a round of golf at El Tinto Golf Course or a tennis session at the Casa Club of Cancun Country Club, making it easy to balance recreation with work or social time.


	These add-ons are fully optional, allowing guests to customize their experience without complicating the stay. With transportation and details handled, guests can focus on the experience itself, moving seamlessly between discovery and downtime without worrying about the logistics.

schema.headline: How Hilton Cancun Takes the Stress Out of Trip Planning

title: Kevin Bacon Fights Tears as He Remembers â€˜A Few Good Menâ€™ Director Rob Reiner: â€˜Everybody Is Hurting Todayâ€™
description: Kevin Bacon was on the verge of tears as he posted an emotional video tribute on Instagram to Rob Reiner, who directed him in the 1992 legal drama â€œ
body:
Kevin Bacon was on the verge of tears as he posted an emotional video tribute on Instagram to Rob Reiner, who directed him in the 1992 legal drama â€œA Few Good Men.â€ It was nominated for four Oscars.

	Reiner and his wife Michele were found dead in their Los Angeles home Sunday, and their son Nick is being held on suspicion of murder. 

	Bacon co-starred as a young Marine captain in the film, which starred Jack Nicholson and Tom Cruise. â€œIâ€™m not sure how to do this,â€ Bacon starts out in the video, sounding emotional. â€œBut Rob Reiner gave me a job in â€˜A Few Good Men.â€™ Sometime in the â€™90s, I guess it was. I was over the moon to get that job â€” people may or may not know but â€˜This Is Spinal Tapâ€™ is my all-time favorite movie and when he called me, I was just so thrilled.
	

	â€œThe making of that movie was one of the best experiences Iâ€™ve ever had on a set,â€ Bacon continued. â€œHe was so fun. It really comes down from the top, you know? You can set a tone where people feel like we are working hard but also working hard in a safe and pleasant and fun situation. You know, we had lunch together every day. Iâ€™ve never done that with a director before or since, Iâ€™d never gone to have lunch. And Michele would be there, and the two of them were so great together. Kyra would come by, she was pregnant, and bring Travis. It was a magical time.

	â€œSo Iâ€™m just sending love to everybody that knew him because I know that everyoneâ€™s hurting today,â€ Bacon concludes.


	Baconâ€™s co-star Demi Moore also had some heartfelt thoughts about her â€œA Few Good Menâ€ director. 
	

	â€œThere are no words to truly express the unfathomable devastation of losing Rob and Michelle Reiner,â€ Moore wrote on Instagram. â€œOur kids grew up together, we worked together, and as our lives intertwined personally and professionally I will always cherish the moments and memories of what we shared.

	â€œThey were amazing people and wonderful parents who gave of themselves to make the world a better place. My heart, thoughts, and prayers are with their family, friends, and all that are affected by this tragedy.â€


	Kiefer Sutherland, whose first film with Reiner was â€œStand By Meâ€ before he went on to play a second lieutenant in â€œA Few Good Men,â€ said in a statement, â€œLike so many, my heart was broken today when I heard the news about Rob Reiner and his wonderful wife, Michele. Rob was one of the kindest gentleman Iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure of working with, when I was very young he gave me an opportunity that changed my life, and I will forever be grateful.â€

schema.headline: Kevin Bacon Fights Tears as He Remembers â€˜A Few Good Menâ€™ Director Rob Reiner: â€˜Everybody Is Hurting Todayâ€™

title: Trump Sues BBC Demanding at Least $10 Billion in Damages Over Edited Jan. 6 Documentary
description: President Donald Trump has followed through on his threat to sue the BBC over the U.K. broadcasterâ€™s documentary that edited his comments during the
body:
President Donald Trump has followed through on his threat to sue the BBC over the U.K. broadcasterâ€™s documentary that edited his comments during the rally leading up to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.

	The lawsuit was filed Monday by Trumpâ€™s lawyers in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida in Miami, alleging defamation and violation of Floridaâ€™s Deceptive and Unfair Trade Practices Act. Trumpâ€™s lawsuit demands no less than $5 billion in damages for each of the two counts, amounting to more than $10 billion total.
	

	â€œThis action concerns a false, defamatory, deceptive, disparaging, inflammatory, and malicious depiction of President Trump, which was published in a BBC Panorama documentary, that was fabricated and aired by the Defendants one week before the 2024 Presidential Election in a brazen attempt to interfere in and influence the Electionâ€™s outcome to President Trumpâ€™s detriment,â€ the 33-page complaint reads. (A copy is available at this link.)


	The Trump lawsuit says, â€œThe BBC, faced with overwhelming and justifiable outrage on both sides of the Atlantic, has publicly admitted its staggering breach of journalistic ethics, and apologized, but has made no showing of actual remorse for its wrongdoing nor meaningful institutional changes to prevent future journalistic abuses. Accordingly, President Trump brings this action for compensatory and punitive damages for the extensive reputational harm inflicted upon him by the Defendants.â€

	The BBC did not immediately respond to a request for comment about Trumpâ€™s lawsuit.
	

	BBC chair Samir Shah last month told staff in an email that the broadcaster was â€œdetermined to fightâ€ any Trump lawsuit. â€œThere is a lot being written, said and speculated upon about the possibility of legal action, including potential costs or settlements,â€ Shah said in the email, as reported by Sky News. Shah wrote, â€œI want to be very clear with you â€” our position has not changed. There is no basis for a defamation case and we are determined to fight this.â€

	The episode of BBCâ€™s â€œPanoramaâ€ documentary program in question, titled â€œTrump: A Second Chance?â€, aired in Oct. 24, 2024 â€” but only erupted into a firestorm after a leaked memo published in early November 2025 by The Telegraph accused the broadcaster of editing Trumpâ€™s speech to make it sound like he encouraged the Jan. 6 riots.

	A BBC review found that â€œPanoramaâ€ edited Trumpâ€™s Jan. 6 speech to be: â€œWeâ€™re gonna walk down to the Capitol and Iâ€™ll be with you and we fight. We fight like hell and if you donâ€™t fight like hell, youâ€™re not gonna have a country anymoreâ€ â€” and that the part beginning with â€œand we fightâ€ came 54 minutes after â€œweâ€™re gonna walk down to the Capitol and Iâ€™ll be with you.â€

	Trumpâ€™s lawsuit cited the BBCâ€™s internal review, which concluded that there had been â€œa string of incidents that demonstrate serious bias in the corporationâ€™s reporting.â€

	The resulting scandal led to the resignations of BBC director general Tim Davie and CEO of news Deborah Turness. 

	A previous letter from Trumpâ€™s lawyers to the BBC demanded a full retraction of the documentary, an apology and payment to â€œappropriately compensate President Trump for the harm caused.â€ Last month, the BBC issued an apology to Trump but refused to offer compensation. In a Nov. 14 statement, the corporation said, â€œWhile the BBC sincerely regrets the manner in which the video clip was edited, we strongly disagree there is a basis for a defamation claim.â€ The BBC also said it has no plans to rebroadcast the â€œTrump: A Second Chance?â€ documentary on any BBC platforms.

	In seeking to establish the U.S. District Courtâ€™s jurisdiction over the matter, Trumpâ€™s lawsuit notes that the U.S. president is a citizen of Florida while all defendants â€œare citizens of the United Kingdom.â€ However, the suit claims, â€œduring the operative period alleged in this Complaint,â€ the BBC â€œengaged in substantial and not isolated business activities in Floridaâ€ â€” including through the bbc.com website and the U.S.-based BritBox streaming service. The â€œPanoramaâ€ episode in question was available via BritBox; in addition, Florida residents likely used VPN software to access the documentary via the BBC iPlayer (normally restricted to access in the U.K.), the lawsuit alleges.
	

	Moreover, â€œas plainly seen in the very beginning of the Panorama Documentary, the BBCâ€™s producers and a film crew contracted by the BBCâ€™s producers traveled to Florida to film significant portions of the Documentary at and around President Trumpâ€™s home, Mar-a-Lago, in Palm Beach, Florida, spending substantial amounts of time in Florida and capturing extensive footage on and around the grounds of Mar-a-Lago, and surrounding areas, that the BBC ultimately used in the Documentary,â€ the Trump lawsuit alleges.

	Trump has a long history of suing news outlets alleging defamation and attacking the media.

	Trump recently sued the New York Times, alleging its reporting about his finances and business career defamed him, in a lawsuit seeking at least $15 billion in damages. (Trump lawyersÂ refiled the suitÂ in October after a judge had dismissed the original complaint for being â€œtedious and burdensome.â€) The New York Times said Trumpâ€™s lawsuit was without meritÂ and called it â€œmerely an attempt to stifle independent reporting and generate PR attention.â€

	Separately,Â Trump this summer sued the Wall Street Journal, its parent companies Dow Jones and News Corp, Rupert Murdoch and two Journal reporters, alleging defamation over a WSJ story that described details of a birthday letter Trump sent in 2003 to Jeffrey Epstein. According to the lawsuit, Trump is demanding â€œnot less than $10 billionâ€ on two counts of defamation, for at least $20 billion total. Lawyers forÂ the Wall Street Journal filed a motion to dismiss the suit, saying that Trumpâ€™s suit should be thrown out because the WSJ article in question â€œis true,â€ noting that in response to a congressional subpoena, â€œEpsteinâ€™s estate produced the Birthday Book, which contains the letter bearing the bawdy drawing and [Trumpâ€™s] signature, exactly as The Wall Street Journal reported.â€

	In 2024, Trump also sued ABC News and CBS Newsâ€™ â€œ60 Minutes.â€ Disney (parent of ABC News) and Paramount Global (parent of CBS) each paid $16 million to settle the cases. Trump sued ABC News and anchor George Stephanopoulos after Stephanopoulos falsely asserted on air that Trump had been found liable in a court case for raping writer E. Jean Carroll; in fact, a jury found Trump guilty of sexual abuse of Carroll. In the â€œ60 Minutesâ€ case, Trump had alleged a pre-election interview with former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris was deceptively edited and thereby interfered with the 2024 election.

schema.headline: Trump Sues BBC Demanding at Least $10 Billion in Damages Over Edited Jan. 6 Documentary

title: Awards HQ: Viola Davis and Austin Butler Rally for â€˜Sinners,â€™ Neon Parties With Kristen Stewart and Elle Fanning, and a Tribute to Rob Reiner
description:
Welcome to Variety Awards HQ â€” your weekly command center for the Oscars race.


	Itâ€™s Dec. 15, 2025, and this edition is dedicated to the
body:
Welcome to Variety Awards HQ â€” your weekly command center for the Oscars race.


	Itâ€™s Dec. 15, 2025, and this edition is dedicated to the magnificent Rob Reiner.

	The news out of Los Angeles is devastating. Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, are no longer with us, and the shock of that loss still hasnâ€™t settled in. In moments like this, language feels inadequate. I wonâ€™t focus on the tragedy. Instead, all we can do is look back â€” at the work, at the moments, at the stories â€” and say thank you.


	The first Rob Reiner film I ever saw was â€œA Few Good Men.â€ I was too young to understand the mechanics of military law or the intricacies of courtroom procedure, but I understood the electricity of conviction. The thrill of watching ideas collide. The power of words when they felt sharp as a blade.
	

	â€œYou canâ€™t handle the truth!â€

	Jack Nicholson roared onto the screen, and even then, it felt like a cultural moment being born in real time. Reiner received his sole Academy Award nomination as a producer on â€œA Few Good Menâ€ (1992), a fitting recognition for a film that crackles with intelligence and moral urgency. Nominated for best picture, it didnâ€™t win the top prize, but it didnâ€™t need to. The film entered the bloodstream of American cinema and never left.

	From that moment on, I was hooked.

	Reinerâ€™s career is one of the most quietly astonishing in modern Hollywood history. Not because he chased prestige â€” on the contrary, he chased truth across genres that rarely get that kind of respect.

	â€œStand by Meâ€ (1986) remains one of the purest coming-of-age films ever made. It understands childhood not as nostalgia, but as a fragile, fleeting state of grace. â€œI never had any friends later on like the ones I had when I was twelve,â€ the film tells us. Neither did we.



	

					STAND BY ME, Director Rob Reiner on set, 1986.
									Â©Columbia Pictures/Courtesy Everett Collection
	



	The train bridge. The leeches. The way he captured River Phoenix, one of my all-time favorite actors â€” itâ€™s all encapsulated in a film that meets you where you are and stays with you long after.
	

	â€œThe Princess Brideâ€ (1987) created joy without irony. Romance without embarrassment. Humor without cruelty.

	â€œHello. My name is Inigo Montoya.â€

	What once struggled at the box office became a generational heirloom, passed down like a favorite bedtime story, reminding us that sincerity is not something to outgrow.

	â€œWhen Harry Met Sallyâ€¦â€ (1989) changed romantic comedies forever, proving they could be adult, literate and honest. Nora Ephronâ€™s dialogue sings, and Reinerâ€™s direction let it breathe. The fake orgasm at Katzâ€™s Deli. The way the film builds to Harryâ€™s New Yearâ€™s Eve confession. It showed the entire genre what was possible.

	Reiner carried that belief into â€œThe American Presidentâ€ (1995), offering a vision of leadership rooted in decency, eloquence and moral clarity. It was romantic, yes, but also aspirational, planting the seeds for what would later grow into â€œThe West Wing.â€ It reminded us what politics could sound like when it aimed higher.

	Reiner could terrify us too. â€œMiseryâ€ (1990) turned psychological horror into something intimate and unbearable, and Kathy Batesâ€™ Oscar-winning performance remains one of the most indelible in Academy history.

	And then there was â€œThis Is Spinal Tapâ€ (1984), a film so inventive it essentially created the mockumentary, forever changing the language of comedy. It goes to eleven, and it always will.

	Before directing, Reiner became part of television history as Michael â€œMeatheadâ€ Stivic on â€œAll in the Family,â€ earning two Emmy Awards and helping redefine what a sitcom could confront and contain. Later, he co-founded Castle Rock Entertainment, the company behind â€œThe Shawshank Redemption,â€ â€œSeinfeldâ€ and so many other landmarks of film and television.

	What made Reiner special was never the trophies. It was his belief that comedy could carry heartbreak, that drama could still be funny, and that genre was not a limitation â€” it was an invitation. He trusted viewers to be smart, curious and open. He trusted all of us. Not many filmmakers do that.

	So thank you for â€œA Few Good Men,â€ the film that started it all for me. Thank you for â€œStand by Me,â€ â€œThe Princess Bride,â€ â€œWhen Harry Met Sallyâ€¦â€ and â€œThe American President.â€ Thank you for teaching us that love can be earnest, friendship can be eternal, and truth, no matter how uncomfortable, is worth fighting for.
	

	Your light lives on in every rewatch, every line read aloud, every perfect moment you gave us. That is immortality. And that is what lasts.

	Rest peacefully, Rob Reiner. Weâ€™ll love you forever.

	Please read my colleague Peter Debrugeâ€™s beautiful tribute on Variety as well.
	
		â€˜Sinnersâ€™ Turns the Town Red With SAG and Academy Power Plays	



	

	



	â€œSinnersâ€ continued its high-profile awards-season rollout with back-to-back industry events targeting key voting bodies.

	On Sunday, Dec. 14, Viola Davis moderated a SAG-AFTRA Foundation Q&A at the Meryl Streep Center for the Performing Arts, joined by actors Michael B. Jordan and Wunmi Mosaku, along with casting director Francine Maisler. The event drew a packed house of SAG-AFTRA members, underscoring the filmâ€™s strong appeal with actors as guild voting intensifies.

	Earlier in the week, Austin Butler hosted a tastemaker screening at Soho House on Monday, Dec. 8, co-hosted by WME. The evening featured a Q&A moderated by Chris Columbus with director-writer-producer Ryan Coogler, Jordan and Maisler, with producer Zinzi Coogler also in attendance.

	The room was filled exclusively with Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences members, signaling a targeted push as phase one Oscar voting heats up.



	

	



	
		Baz Luhrmann, Michael Keaton and Edward Norton Host Star-Driven â€˜Train Dreamsâ€™ Events	



	

					LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA â€“ DECEMBER 09: (L-R) Baz Luhrmann, Joel Edgerton, and Clint Bentley attend Netflixâ€™s â€œTrain Dreamsâ€ Baz Luhrmann Hosted Cocktail Reception at Chateau Marmont on December 09, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Presley Ann/Getty Images for Netflix)
									Getty Images for Netflix
	



	Joel Edgertonâ€™s awards-season presence continues to build with two high-profile industry gatherings aimed squarely at guild and Academy voters.

	On Tuesday, Nov. 9, Baz Luhrmann hosted an intimate reception in honor of Edgerton, whom he directed in â€œThe Great Gatsbyâ€ (2012). The event drew a notable crowd that included Oscar nominees Edward Norton and Steven Yeun, in addition to Tobey Maguire, Phoebe Dynevor and Christina Hendricks.

	Momentum carried through Thursday, Nov. 11, when Oscar nominee Michael Keaton (â€œBirdmanâ€) hosted a screening and Q&A at CAA with Edgerton and the filmâ€™s director and co-writer Clint Bentley.

	The event attracted a full room of AMPAS, along with major guild voters of WGA, DGA and PGA.



	

	



	
		Peacock Celebrates â€˜All Her Faultâ€™ With Decision-Free Dinner at Chateau Marmont	



	

					ALL HER FAULT â€” Decision-Free Dinner â€” Pictured: (l-r) Shelley Zalis, Eve Rodsky, Dakota Fanning at the Chateau Marmont on December 10, 2025 â€” (Photo by: Todd Williamson/Peacock)
									Todd Williamson/Peacock
	



	Peacock and The Female Quotient marked the awards-season momentum of breakout TV hit â€œAll Her Faultâ€ with an intimate dinner on Wednesday, Dec. 10, at the Chateau Marmont.

	The â€œdecision-freeâ€ evening celebrated the series â€” Peacockâ€™s biggest original launch to date â€” as it begins its early Emmy run for next year amid Golden Globe and Critics Choice nominations.

	Hosted by pop culture critic and â€œShut Up Evanâ€ creator Evan Ross Katz, with Dakota Fanning serving as the nightâ€™s special guest, the gathering was designed as a rare pause for women accustomed to carrying the mental and emotional load of daily life. Every detail was handled, allowing guests to simply arrive, unwind and engage in discussion centered on the showâ€™s themes of female resilience, empowerment and self-preservation.
	

	The dinner brought together a cross-section of influential voices spanning advocacy, entertainment and pop culture, including Shelley Zalis, Eve Rodsky, Gabrielle Stone, Haley Melikian, Blakely Thornton, Hannah Pistoia, Anna Konkle, Cheri Oteri, Megan Stalter, Parvati Shallow and Renata Ribeiro.




	

					Park Chan-wook and Paul Feig at the Los Angeles premiere of â€œNo Other Choice,â€ with director Park Chan-wook 
									Jay L. Clendenin/for Neon
	


	
		Neon Lights Up December With â€˜No Other Choiceâ€™ L.A. Premiere With Park Chan-wook	

	Neon closed out Dec. 9 with a trio of high-profile events for its international slate.

	The day began in Los Angeles with the red-carpet premiere of Park Chan-wookâ€™s â€œNo Other Choiceâ€ at the Academy Museumâ€™s David Geffen Theater, continued with an intimate tastemaker screening for Joachim Trierâ€™s â€œSentimental Value,â€ and culminated with Neonâ€™s annual holiday party in New York, drawing one of the seasonâ€™s most eclectic guest lists.

	At the Academy Museum, â€œNo Other Choiceâ€ rolled out in full awards-season form, featuring a red carpet, screening, filmmaker Q&A and after-party. Director Park Chan-wook and star Lee Byung Hun led the evening, participating in a post-screening conversation that highlighted the filmâ€™s creative ambitions.

	The premiere drew an impressive cross-section of industry figures, including director Paul Feig (pictured) with his wife Laurie Feig, Julie Delpy, Tatiana Maslany, Dan Stevens, Hideo Kojima, Omar Benson Miller, Janicza Bravo, Mimi Rogers and Daniel Scheinert.

	Across town, Coach hosted an intimate screening and dinner celebrating global ambassador Elle Fanning and her latest film, â€œSentimental Value,â€ at San Vicente Bungalows.

	The celebrations extended to the East Coast with Neonâ€™s holiday party at San Vicente West Village in New York, where filmmakers and talent from across the companyâ€™s slate gathered under one roof.

	Attendees included Park Chan-wook, Lee Byung Hun, Elle Fanning and Kristen Stewart (pictured below), Joachim Trier, Stellan Skarsgard, Renate Reinsve, Alexander Skarsgard, Kristen Stewart, Wagner Moura, Oliver Laxe, Kleber MendonÃ§a Filho, Clark Gregg, among others.



	

									Jade Greene
	



	
		Dwayne Johnson Set for â€˜The Smashing Machineâ€™ Conversation at SAG-AFTRA Foundation	



	

	



	Dwayne Johnson will headline an upcoming SAG-AFTRA Foundation screening and conversation for â€œThe Smashing Machineâ€ on Wednesday, Dec. 17, at the Meryl Streep Center for the Performing Arts.

	The event will begin with a morning screening, followed by a moderated discussion by Clayton Davis, with Johnson exploring his performance and the filmâ€™s creative journey.
	

	Hosted at the SAG-AFTRA Foundationâ€™s flagship venue, the gathering is expected to draw a huge crowd from guild members as Johnson continues to expand his dramatic footprint and angle for Oscar recognition for his towering performance in Benny Safdieâ€™s emotional drama.

	
		Spotlight on the Sound of â€˜SirÄtâ€™ with Composer Kangding Ray and Sound Designer Laia Casanovas	



	

	



	As awards-season attention turns toward below-the-line artistry, a newly released clip highlighting the sound design of â€œSirÃ¢tâ€ puts a spotlight on the filmâ€™s immersive sonic craftsmanship.

	The showcase shows the collaborative work of composer Kangding Ray and sound designer Laia Casanovas, whose contributions have been central to the filmâ€™s sensory impact.

schema.headline: Awards HQ: Viola Davis and Austin Butler Rally for â€˜Sinners,â€™ Neon Parties With Kristen Stewart and Elle Fanning, and a Tribute to Rob Reiner

title: Jimmy Kimmel Slams Donald Trump as â€˜Hateful and Vileâ€™ For Saying Rob Reiner Had â€˜Trump Derangement Syndromeâ€™: â€˜That Corroded Brain Is in Charge of Our Livesâ€™
description: Jimmy Kimmel slammed Donald Trump during his Monday night broadcast of â€œJimmy Kimmel Live!â€ for saying Rob Reiner died â€œdue to the anger he caused o
body:
Jimmy Kimmel slammed Donald Trump during his Monday night broadcast of â€œJimmy Kimmel Live!â€ for saying Rob Reiner died â€œdue to the anger he caused othersâ€ through his â€œTrump derangement syndrome.â€

	â€œWhat we need at a time like this, besides common sense when it comes to guns and mental health care, is compassion and leadership. We did not get that from our president, because he has none of it to give. Instead, we got a fool rambling about nonsense,â€ Kimmel said. â€œFor Rob and Michele Reiner, we got this post.â€
	

	Kimmel then recited Trumpâ€™s Monday morning Truth Social post, which read, â€œA very sad thing happened last night in Hollywood. Rob Reiner, a tortured and struggling, but once very talented movie director and comedy star, has passed away, together with his wife, Michele, reportedly due to the anger he caused others through his massive, unyielding, and incurable affliction with a mind crippling disease known as TRUMP DERANGEMENT SYNDROME, sometimes referred to as TDS.â€


	The president continued, â€œHe was known to have driven people CRAZY by his raging obsession of President Donald J. Trump, with his obvious paranoia reaching new heights as the Trump Administration surpassed all goals and expectations of greatness, and with the Golden Age of America upon us, perhaps like never before. May Rob and Michele rest in peace!â€

	â€œItâ€™s so hateful and vile,â€ Kimmel said of the post. â€œWhen I first saw it, I thought it was fake. My wife showed it to me this morning. I was like, â€˜Even for him, that seemed like too much.â€™ But nothing is ever too much for him.â€
	

	Kimmel then turned his attention to an Oval Office press conference, where Trump was given â€œthe chance to take another shot to act like a human beingâ€ and take back his post on Reiner. Trump instead doubled down.

	â€œI wasnâ€™t a fan of his at all,â€ Trump told reporters Monday. â€œHe was a deranged person as far as Trump is concerned. He knew it was false. In fact, itâ€™s the exact opposite. He said I was a friend of Russia, controlled by Russia. You know, the Russia hoax. He was one of the people behind it. I think he hurt himself career-wise. He became like a deranged person. Trump derangement syndrome. So, I was not a fan of Rob Reiner at all, in any way, shape or form. I thought he was very bad for our country.â€

	â€œThat corroded brain is in charge of our lives,â€ Kimmel said. â€œIf you voted for that, itâ€™s okay to reconsider. Itâ€™s perfectly fine. I have to say, I know from my personal interactions with Rob Reiner that he would want us to keep pointing out the loathsome atrocities that continue to ooze out of this sick and irresponsible manâ€™s mouth. So weâ€™re going to do that over and over again until the rest of us wake up.â€

	Kimmel wasnâ€™t the only late-night host to discuss Reiner. While not discussing it during the show, Colbert opened his Monday night broadcast with a preface in light of Reinerâ€™s death, as well as the shootings at Bondi Beach and Brown University. 

	â€œHello, everybody,â€ a somber Colbert said at his desk. â€œNormally, we start the show with a short cold open about a major news story of the day. But after the terrible news this past weekend, the horrifying Hanukkah massacre at Bondi Beach, the tragic shootings at Brown University and the heartbreaking deaths of Rob and Michele Reiner, all of the major stories are too dark for that. Other peopleâ€™s tragedy is sacred ground, and we try very hard not to walk there. But we are going to do a comedy show tonight, in light of and in spite of the darkness.â€

	Reiner, a prolific filmmaker who broke into Hollywood starring in â€œAll in the Familyâ€ before directing films like â€œStand by Me,â€ â€œWhen Harry Met Sallyâ€¦,â€ â€œThis Is Spinal Tapâ€ and â€œA Few Good Men,â€ was found stabbed to death Sunday afternoon in his Brentwood home alongside his wife of 36 years, Michele Singer. Reiner was 78 and Singer was 68.
	

	Nick Reiner, the son of Rob and Michele, was arrested on Sunday at 9:15 p.m. and booked on Monday at 5:05 a.m. on suspicion of his parentsâ€™ murder, per the Los Angeles County Sheriffâ€™s Department online records.

	LAPD Chief Jim McDonnell confirmed during a Monday morning press conference that Nick Reiner had been â€œbooked for murder.â€ He added that it was a â€œvery, very tragic incident.

	Charges have not been filed. The LAPD said in a press release that investigators are expected to submit the case to the D.A. for filing on Tuesday.

schema.headline: Jimmy Kimmel Slams Donald Trump as â€˜Hateful and Vileâ€™ For Saying Rob Reiner Had â€˜Trump Derangement Syndromeâ€™: â€˜That Corroded Brain Is in Charge of Our Livesâ€™

title: Holiday Gift Guide: Last Minute Panic Purchases for Him
body:
TMZ may collect a share of sales or other compensation from links on this page.
      
    
          Looking for some high quality gifts for your BF this holiday season and still short on ideas?
      
    
          Well, we've got you covered with options ranging from super comfy noise cancelling headphones to the best fitness accessory for the gym rat in your life, like the Fitbit Versa 4 Fitness Smartwatch.
      
    
          Single this year? These gifts -- all available on Amazon -- also make great presents for dad, friends ... and any siblings you wanna spoil!
      
    
          TMZ CHEAT SHEET:
  
    
          Bose QuietComfort Bluetooth Headphones -- $200.00CHEF iQ Sense Smart Wireless Meat Thermometer -- $160Fitbit Versa 4 Fitness Smartwatch -- $120Ninja DZ550 Smart XL Air Fryer -- $130Meta Quest 3S -- $250Solo Stove Bonfire -- $320PlayStation DualSenseÂ® Wireless Controller - Galactic Purple -- $73Beats Pill - Portable Bluetooth Speakers -- $100Casio Royale -- $43Ring Battery Doorbell -- $60
      
    
              
      Bose QuietComfort Bluetooth Headphones
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Just like the music industry adapts to consumers' listening habits, these Bose QuietComfort Bluetooth Headphones do the same!
      
    
          On top of having multiple color options, noise-cancelling abilities, comfortable pads, all day battery life, and a multipoint toggle feature, you can also download an app that makes sure these headphones are up to date with their latest features to make your listening experience the best it can be.
      
    
              
      CHEF iQ Sense Smart Wireless Meat Thermometer
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Take the guesswork out of cooking the turkey this holiday season with the CHEF iQ Sense Smart Wireless Meat Thermometer.
      
    
          Have no worries about serving undercooked meat with this smart thermometer that provides real-time updates right to your phone, wherever you are. Youâ€™ll know exact internal temperatures, get reminders when to flip and see estimated cooking times. Plus, the new 2025 edition is built to endure 1000Â°F heat and features an ultra-thin probe design to keep proteins intact and juices inside!
      
    
              
      Fitbit Versa 4 Fitness Smartwatch
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          If you're looking for a stylish way to keep yourself inspired and accountable, then definitely get your hands ... or rather one of your wrists ... on the Fitbit Versa 4 Fitness Smartwatch.
      
    
          This little device packs a heavy punch with its features, which include a daily readiness score, built-in GPS, and a workout intensity map. It tracks your heartrate 24/7, and bolsters 40+ exercise modes with automatic tracking. It also has a personalized sleep profile, daily sleep stages, and a sleep score for when you're not pumping iron and actually getting some shut-eye.
      
    
              
      Ninja DZ550 Smart XL Air Fryer
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          Take your cooking to the next level with this Ninja Foodi Air Fryer.
      
    
          Not only can you get the benefits of a standard air fryer, but this device has five other cooking settings: air broil, roast, bake, reheat, and dehydrate. With two extra large baskets, save yourself some time by cooking two dishes at once -- two different ways!
      
    
          With a wide temperature range, your meals will be ready in no time. Cook a full 6-lb. chicken 30% faster than a traditional oven and take your frozen dishes from cold to crispy in no time.
      
    
              
      Meta Quest 3S
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Enter a whole new world with the Meta Quest 3S!
      
    
          If youâ€™ve been dying to try a virtual reality device, you can now score a major deal on this next-gen headset. With crisper visuals, fast load times and smoother performance than ever before, youâ€™ll quickly become immersed in everything the Quest has to offer â€¦ from gaming to fitness to entertainment and beyond.
      
    
              
      Solo Stove Bonfire with Stand
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Goin' camping during the holidays? Or want to keep warm around an outdoor fireplace you don't actually have yet? Well, this Solo Stove Bonfire with Stand is the answer!
      
    
          Enjoy the smoke-free fire thatâ€™s perfect for any outdoor setting. From camping trips to backyard gatherings ... and it's easy to clean with a removable ash pan and base!
      
    
              
      PlayStation DualSenseÂ® Wireless Controller
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          If you're on team PlayStation, then show your true colors with this PlayStation DualSenseÂ® Wireless Controller - Galactic Purple!
      
    
          Whether it's Fortnite, Battlefield, Monster Hunter, or Spider-Man, you take the game to the next level with this controller in your hand! The applications for this controller are almost as versatile as the PlayStation's game catalog with the USB-C ... almost.
      
    
              
      Beats Pill
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Carry your music with you with the Beats Pill - Portable Bluetooth Speaker, the best remedy for any mundane situation.
      
    
          It comes in red, gold, black, grey, and light grey ... not with the water droplets -- that's just to show it's waterproof! And with 24 hour battery life, you get a whole days worth of your music, with premier sound and maximum bass power.
      
    
              
      James Bond-Inspired Casio Royale
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          When you have to save the world with class and just in the nick of time, be sure to wear this Casio Royale, inspired by the watch seen in "Octopussy," with a nickname playing tribute to "Casino Royale."
      
    
          Just like any 007 gadget from Q, this one comes with plenty of features -- including a stainless steel back, a minute clock display, a real time display with the day of the week and date, and a world map display. You will know exactly where you are as you jump between all of the globe's fanciest nations on your own high-stakes adventures.
      
    
              
      Ring Outdoor Cam Plus
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          If the Eye of Sauron had a Ring Outdoor Cam Plus, the Lord of the Rings would have worked out much better for him.
      
    
          Guard your house day or night, with a wide field of view that makes your home feel like a cozy fortress. Allow yourself the opportunity to relax, knowing the Ring is always watching the house for you, whether you're away on vacation, or chilling in your living room!
      
    
          Sign up for Amazon PrimeÂ to get the best deals --Â and see more holiday gift guides here!
      
    
          All prices and availability subject to change -- and be sure to double check delivery dates before ordering!

      Elphaba Fashion Doll
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Fly high with the Wicked: for Good Elphaba Deluxe Doll!

She also includes her broom, hat, boots â€¦and, of course, the Grimmerie, which can even open and close.
      
    
              
      Monster High Dolls
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Monsters, monsters, yes we are! Everyoneâ€™s favorite Monster High dolls just got a makeover and are channeling their inner mistresses of the dark. With the Monster High x Elvira and the Monster High x Wednesday Addams collaborations, fans of all things spooky will die to see these dolls under the tree.
      
    
          And if theyâ€™re looking for the dolls that everyone already knows and loves, thereâ€™s plenty more on the Monster High Amazon Storefront.
      
    
              
      Little People Collector Home Alone
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          As we approach the holidays, there's no better time to get your hands on this Little People Collector Home Alone box.
      
    
          In this set you get a smirking Kevin, you get Harry with his post-burn bald spot, and you get Marv with a red mark on his face! It's a wonderful holiday gift for your kid ... who you hopefully won't abandon by jumping on a plane without them this Christmas.
      
    
              
      LEGO Wicked Glinda's Wedding Day
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Experience the excitement and drama of Glindaâ€™s special day as she gets ready to say â€œI doâ€ in this detailed LEGO Wicked Glinda's Wedding Day Set.
      
    
          Posable LEGO butterflies pull apart to reveal a movie-accurate wedding scene with details including a wedding cake and heart-shaped invitations. And as things go amiss, you can switch her facial expression from happy to horrified to reflect the unfolding scene.
      
    
              
      Students of Shiz Multipack
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Transport yourself to Shiz University with the Students of Shiz Small Doll Multipack.
      
    
          The iconic crew of BFFs includes Elphaba, Glinda, Nessarose, Fiyero and Boq, all dressed in their signature school looks. The set comes with nine storytelling accessories too, ensuring that this crew is ready for any adventure in Oz and beyond!
      
    
              
      Hot Wheels Monster Trucks
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Dennis Anderson has got nothing on this awesome Hot Wheels Monster Trucks ... this one is a large scale RC Tiger Shark!
      
    
          We hope you have some ramps in the house because once your kid gets their hands on this bad boy, pretty much anything could turn into this monster truck's arena. Just be sure they keep this one away from any lamps!
      
    
              
      Transformers EarthSpark Optimus Prime Battle Trailer Playset
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Autobots, roll out! This Transformers EarthSpark Optimus Prime Battle Trailer Playset is here to acquire the Allspark!
      
    
          This converting playset changes from an epic battle station with a projectile launcher into an attachable trailer for Optimus. It stands at 5 inches tall, and is every bit Megatron's worst nightmare as you'd expect!
      
    
              
      MAGNA-TILES
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Let your imagination run wild with these incredibly popular MAGNA-TILES.
      
    
          All of these 32 translucent geometric shapes come in 6 different colors. The set includes Squares -- 2 Large, 14 Small -- and Triangles Â -- 8 Equilateral, 4 Right, 4 Isosceles -- and they're not here just to help you learn geometry, they're here to help you create your hyper-futuristic city!
      
    
              
      Juicy Couture Pink and Precious Bracelets
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Get blinged out with this Juicy Couture Pink and Precious Bracelets kit, where you become the fashion diva and control which precious gems go in your bracelets!
      
    
          That's right! You get to create and design your own Juicy Couture bracelet with this DIY jewelry kit, that has a whole bunch of jewels to choose from, giving you so many options to suit whatever you're wearing!
      
    
              
      National Geographic Stunning Chemistry Set
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Inspire the mad scientists in your house, safely, with this National Geographic Stunning Chemistry Set!
      
    
          Your kids will have hours of fun as they explore the fizzy and bubbly reactions they create! And the best part is, if they spill, it won't be a drop of sulfuric acid wreaking havoc on your home.
      
    
              
      Monopoly DreamWorks How to Train Your Dragon Edition
      
        
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          A pet dragon ... AND you get to own all of Berk? Count us in with this Monopoly DreamWorks How to Train Your Dragon Edition!
      
    
          To win, you just have to be the first Viking to train and ride every class of dragon! Start with some lessons, and then test out your abilities in the Arena and around the village of Berk. Odin help you, though ... you'll find that Dragons are harder to contain than regular old property.
      
    
          Sign up for Amazon Prime to get the best deals.
      
    
          All prices and availability subject to change -- check delivery date before ordering!

schema.headline: Holiday Gift Guide: Last Minute Panic Purchases for Kids

title: Billy Crystal Saw Rob and Michele Reiner's Slain Bodies
description:
Rob & Michele Reiner Murders
                          Billy Crystal Saw Dead Bodies
body:
Rob & Michele Reiner Murders
                          Billy Crystal Saw Dead Bodies
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                December 15, 2025
                
                            3:37 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 15, 2025
                                6:33 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Billy Crystal and his wife Janice saw the slain bodies of Rob Reiner and his wife Michele ... because TMZ has learned they arrived at the scene in a flash after a family member called them about the horrific discovery.
      
    
          Sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ ... Rob and Michele's daughter Romy called Crystal and his wife not long after she called police to report finding her parents brutally murdered inside their Brentwood home Sunday.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Sources with direct knowledge tell us Billy and his wife raced over to the house -- and were there so quickly, one source tells us -- the couple actually saw their slain friends ... and wanted to say their goodbyes.
      

          As you know, Rob and Michele were found Sunday afternoon â€¦ their son Nick was located and arrested on suspicion of murder about six hours later â€¦ he's currently being held without bail on suicide watch.

title: Nick Reiner Held on Suicide Watch After Arrest on Suspicion of Killing Parents
description:
Rob & Michele Reiner
                          Son On Suicide Watch ...
body:
Rob & Michele Reiner
                          Son On Suicide Watch ...
                          After Arrest in Parents' Murder Case
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                December 15, 2025
                
                            3:12 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 15, 2025
                                4:27 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Nick Reiner is on suicide watch after being arrested on suspicion of murdering his parents, Rob and Michele Reiner ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          Law enforcement sources tell TMZ ... Nick is on suicide watch and in administrative segregation at Twin Towers Correctional Facility in L.A. ... while he's being held without bail.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As we reported ... prior to Rob and Michele's stabbing, Nick got into a "very loud argument" with his father at Conan O'Brien's Christmas party Saturday night. We're told the shouting match was loud enough for many others to hear, and that Rob and Michele then left the party. We do not know if Nick left with them.
      

          A source told us Nick looked out of place at the party, mostly keeping to himself.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Our family sources told us â€¦ Michele had been anguishing to friends over the last few months that she and Rob were at their wits' end over Nick's mental illness and alleged substance abuse issues, and did not know what to do with their son Nick ... saying, "We've tried everything."
      
    
          As you know ... the legendary actor-director and his wife were found in their L.A.-area house Sunday with their throats slit. Nick was arrested Monday morning and booked for murder.
